alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Northwest Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:39PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Walla Walla and western Columbia Counties through 415 PM PDT... At 339 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dixie, or 9 miles south of Dayton, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Waitsburg, Starbuck, Dixie, Huntsville and Delaney. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Northwest Blue Mountains
